transcripts.text: Hi, how's it going everybody?  This is Stuart to work for the National Party.  This is Patrick Quinlan from the National Party, Dublin West.  We've decided to come in here and pay a visit today to the Green Party headquarters and hoping we might get to possibly bump into Minister Roderick O'Gorman and the new Minister for Children.  God help us.  We're going to do a little ring of the old doorbell and call these people and see what they answer us and we're going to ask for a comment from the Green Party about the new Minister for Children, Roderick O'Gorman.  and see has he got a comment to make about his association with Peter Tatchell.  How do you feel about this?  Are you aware of Roderick O'Gorman, the new Minister for Children?  Are you aware of who he has associates with?  It's all over social media.  And RT aren't, they're not reporting on it.

There's a picture of him, there's a picture of him on his Twitter account with this associate.  The name's very interesting.  If only he looked at his Twitter account, he'd actually be able to go, oh.

It's not somebody in their basement, it's his account.  So, my name's Philip Dore, by the way, from the National Park.  It's on its own account, but it's going to be exposed.  It's going to be a big story, and we're going to expose it.  So it'll be maybe a good story for you to expose, if you weren't afraid of the establishment.
Probably, like, it'd be alright if the National Broadcast had actually done its job, you know what I mean?  As opposed to just spinning some narrative.

Here's the Minister for Children, and it's associating with people who are sympathetic to paedophilia.  What do you say?  Do you see or catch it?  They'll do it.  They'll do it.  Yes.  So what that means for children

associate with these people who are putting some kind of a walk justification around paedophilia, 9 to 13 year old kids that are having that have had sex with adults, he's trying to claim that this was normal, this was joyous for the kids, these people who are now grown-ups.  So we want to know why he's associating, what's his association with these people, and the RTE should be reporting on it.  So, as you can see, the building is suaded with these flags of the LGBT community.
Strangely enough, there doesn't seem to be a tricolour outside the office at all, Philip.

Yeah, well, as I said, this has nothing to do with the Irish people.  These flags represent globalism, they represent pro-abortion, they represent mass migration, they represent basically the destruction of Irish society as we know it.  And we're not happy about this in the National Party.  I'm not happy about this as an Irish citizen.  And we are disgusted about the appointment of this man as Minister for Children.  First of all, his qualifications, that he doesn't have any children of his own.  He's never reared children.  He's never brought children into the world.  And how does he get a qualification to be over the children of this country and making crucial decisions about their education and about their care?
